result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kody F. Lalonde

records.addlTxt:
3:10 PM Defendant Kody F. Lalonde in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Kody F. Lalonde.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF48 and 22CF99.
Competency report.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed the report with the Deft - no objections.
DA heard - has reviewed the report - no objections.
Court heard and finds the Deft is currently not competent to proceed.
Court orders Deft to comply with psychotropic medications.
If not taken as prescribed, the meds will be involuntary provided.
DA heard on credit for 22CF48.
Parties stipulate to 24 days credit for time served.
DA heard on credit for 22CF99.
Parties stipulate to 111 days credit for time served.
DA to submit the orders.
3:17 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Order for Competency examination by department of health services

3:48 PM Defendant Kody F. Lalonde appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Kody F. Lalonde.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF48 and 22CF99.
Atty Spansail heard and requests a competency evaluation be completed.
DA heard and does not take a position on it.
Court finds there is probable cause to proceed on both cases.
Court orders the State to order a competency evaluation.
Evaluation can be an out-patient evaluation.
Court schedules with parties.
3:52 PM
Competency hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

Defendant Kody F. Lalonde appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Kody F. Lalonde.  Attorney Kathryn Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
2:58 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests STC to track w/other case.
ADA agrees.
Atty Spansail will file motion to modify bond.
3:00 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kody F. Lalonde appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Kody F. Lalonde. 
3:23 p.m.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Court schedules Arraignment. 
3:26 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Defendant Kody F. Lalonde in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Defendant Kody F. Lalonde in custody.  robert James mraz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kody F. Lalonde appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no contact with Seguin's BP gas station. 
Atty Spansail heard - deft does qualify for PD representation.
He will represent the deft on this case as well.
Court schedules with parties.
11:31 AM
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
